channel.title: Comments on: An interview with Professor Samuel Fleischacker
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Yehuda Gellman
item.dc:creator: Yehuda Gellman
item.description: In your interview you attribute to me the view that passages were tacked on to the Torah. I wish to correct that attribution. In my review I suggested that the author might have done better, given his position, to take instead any of three positions or combinations of them. I did not state my own view on the matter, and tacking-on was only one of the three. In fact I am not a tacker-on-er myself. My own view tends toward reinterpretation and especially invoking divine concession. Thank you, Yehuda Gellman
item.content:encoded: In your interview you attribute to me the view that passages were tacked on to the Torah. I wish to correct that attribution. In my review I suggested that the author might have done better, given his position, to take instead any of three positions or combinations of them. I did not state my own view on the matter, and tacking-on was only one of the three. In fact I am not a tacker-on-er myself. My own view tends toward reinterpretation and especially invoking divine concession. Thank you, Yehuda Gellman

item.title: By: rabbifink
item.dc:creator: rabbifink
item.description: Great stuff. Thanks for the interview.
